list-item.p: Inadequate risk assessment by the Chinese government hampered efforts to contain the virus.
The current novel coronavirus (COVID-19) has surpassed Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in the number of cases and deaths from the disease.
Closure of the live-animal markets in China may decrease the likelihood of another zoonotic outbreak occurring.
Human-to-human transmission has been confirmed, and although several measures have been taken to mitigate the virusâ€™ spread, travel to impacted regions should be avoided if possible.
